info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 07 at 4:18PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Chesterfield, northwestern Prince George, northern Dinwiddie and southeastern Amelia Counties, the City of Colonial Heights, the City of Hopewell and the City of Petersburg through 500 PM EDT... At 418 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Scotts Fork to Dinwiddie. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Dinwiddie around 425 PM EDT. Sutherland around 430 PM EDT. Moseley, Virginia State University and Matoaca around 455 PM EDT. Petersburg, Fort Gregg-Adams, Prince George and Ettrick around 500 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Winterpock, Burgess, Birchett Estate, Addison, Reams, Earls, Ammon, Jordan Point Country Club, Petersburg National Battlefield and Pocahontas State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
